course.subject: HART
course.name: Fundamental Technique of Chinese Painting
course.description: This course introduces students to the theories and practice of the various themes of traditional Chinese painting, including Flowers and Birds, Landscape and Figure painting. Through appreciation of masterpieces, in‐class demonstration and class discussion, students will acquire a fundamental knowledge of the historical development and theoretical issues of Chinese painting. Students will learn the basic technique of different brush works, through which they will understand the creative process of Chinese painting, and they will be encouraged to create their own works through the application of the technique and attempt to reform this traditional art form.

reviews.author: hlp
reviews.comment_content:
4 topics covered: 四君子，水族遊魚，春花， 山水基礎.
a cycle a topic: 示範、繪畫練習、臨摹、作品觀摩、討論.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The prof is very nice and interactive.

She will do a demo in class one time for each topics and tell u the technique used in painting and coloring briefly. However u have to practice a lot to copy her technique.
When u are practicing in class she will come to guide and correct each person.  The prof also tries to help us improve the painting every time before submitting the work.

Note that the teaching and all the materials are in Chinese.  This course might not be suitable for native english speakers
reviews.comment_grading:
1. Attendance 10%
Each absent and late arrival (more than 10 min) will lead to a  deduction of 1%.

2. Participation 15%
- Discussion in class
- A visit to a Chinese painting exhibition (only need to state the name and the date of the exhibition u visited at the end of the course.)

3. Assignments
- Assignment 1   20%
    四君子： 菊花 2幅  (1 幅黑白水墨，1 幅顏色)

- Assignment 2   35%
   水族： 鯉魚＋花 1幅
   春花： 紫藤＋鳥 1幅

- Assignment 3   20%
  山水 1幅

Assessment Details
1. Composition佈局與構圖:
The relationship between the images and the negative space(concrete objects vs. void)

2. Brush work and Technique技法運用
Using a corresponding brush work technique to execute. A good coloring may enhance the aesthetic of the painting too.  

3. Finishing and Aura of the art piece作品的整合及意境
Harmonious combination of those painting elements

*10% of mark will be deducted per day in case of late submission of assignments.*

I got around 75% in total, got a B- overall, which is fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
You have to practice a lot to master the techniques in painting and the coloring.  you can finish the assignments in class if u can master the techniques quickly.  However i had to paint the same drawing multiple times to get a satisfied work,  for the perfection.

Note that u need to go buy all the tools for the painting, which will cost around $200.  You also need to bring them to class and clean them after class every time.  i had another class right after this one, therefore i was always late for the other class. Wise words:  Reg a locker if u gonna take this course!!

Overall the course is fun and enjoyable, with acceptable workload.

reviews.author: lmw
reviews.comment_content:
Include basic techniques and concepts for Chinese painting. Through the lessons as well as imitation of art work, can learn to appreciate different masterpieces.

Contents include: 四君子畫 (梅蘭菊竹), 水族游魚, 荷花, 山水. We studied 菊 for the semester but I want 竹 more actually... You have to prepare some 毛筆, Chinese-painting colours, Chinese-painting papers for the lessons.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is nice and punctual. And she is enthusiastic with advising students with their work which I appreciate. It seems she also teaches Chinese painting II. The course is conducted in Cantonese so it's actually difficult for non-local students...
reviews.comment_grading:
It is quite depends on individuals. If you're good at drawing or have basic techniques of using 毛筆, it would be an advantage.

Attendance 10% (1% deducted for 1 absent)
Participation 15%
Assignment 1 20%
Assignment 2 35%
Assignment 3 20%
reviews.comment_workload: Practices are needed for sure. For me, I don't recommend to take it during fall or spring semester as it's difficult to spare time for practices. It is possible to take a whole day or more for practices if you like Chinese painting or want to get a good grade. But sadly it is only 1 credit... Anyway, if you like Chinese painting, I strongly recommend this course. It's full of fun and you'll enjoy!

reviews.author: Coco Yiu
reviews.comment_content:
Basic techniques and concepts of chinese painting are taught.
There were total 4 topics to study in summer semester, including 四君子畫, 水族游魚, 荷花, 山水. Lessons mainly focus on practicing and demonstration.
reviews.comment_teaching:
All lectures are conducted in cantonese, which is really great. Instructor spent time with students for individual advising, telling each of us what to improve.
But, sometimes she did talk boringly during demonstration making us fell alseep...
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance 10%
Participation 15% (visit of exhibition)
Assignment 1 20% (2 paintings of imitating)
Assignment 2 35% (2 paintings of creation)
Assignment 3 20% (1 painting of creation)

Total score around 85%: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
For those are interested in art and painting, workload would not be heavy. Only numbers of painting are needed in the whole semester.
However, self-practicing after lessons is important which makes you skilled for better assignments.

reviews.author: Michelle Chang
reviews.comment_content: The content is interesting, and very practical. This course is very different from other uni courses as there is nothing to memorise or recite. The class is similar to the art classes we had in high school.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is very friendly and kind. She will be very willing to help if you are facing difficulties
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair, got 3-4/5 for all assignments, got b+
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is heavy as a 1 credit course, as attendence is required and time spent to finsih the assignment is quite significant
